content: queen of hearts socks mid-calf socks with unusual cuff and simple heel for valentine day author @knitting_hour on instagram and ravelry you need - double pointed needles or circular needles with 80-100 сm for «magic loop» technique 2 0 mm for toe and the inside of the serrated edge of cuff 2 25 mm for plain body 2 5 mm for jacquard - sock blockers - markers - darning tapestry needle - fingering weight yarn - 200-210m/50 g two skeins with 50 g two contrast colors which you love gauge 27 stiches x 40 row in 10 сm you can make measurement as on the scheme down make your sample of broken rib pattern 4 x 1 and count you own gauge for this socks the count of stitches must be multiple of 10 for example 60 70 or 80 stitches in the round translation 1 foot length 2 big foot circumference 3 small foot circumference 4 oblique foor circumference scheme and start the socks are knitted top down to the toe round using an auxiliary thread on 2 0 mm knitting needles cast on the number of loops you calculated in my case 60 using a red yarn knit 7 row in the 8th row to form a jagged edge we knit stitches according to the pattern * yarn over knit 2 stitches together repeat from * to the end of the row next we move on to the knitting needles for the main body of socks 2 25 mm we knit 7 more row we connect the cast-on edge and the last 15 row together and remove auxiliary thread we move on to the main body and knit 3-5 row only in red color based on the scheme for two colors and changing the knitting needles to a larger size for jacquard 2 5 mm we knit the pattern according to the diagram below adding blue color go on cuff next we cut the red thread and knit the desired number of row down in blue switching to a broken rib pattern 4 by 1 - we knit 4 loops with knit stitches and we knit - in odd row - with purl stitches every fifth loop and in even row - with knit stitches the scheme below is multiple of 5 stitches should help you all row on the scheme for knitting round | - knit -- - purl please note that the purl loops continue the motif of the jacquard pattern and coincide with the middle of the hearts and the edges of the arches as on the photo of socks heel start to end let s divide the total number of sock stitches into 2 parts - upper and lower for me it is 60/2 = 30 stitches each we find 10 central loops on the bottom side mark them with markers 30 = 10 + 10 + 10 for 70 stitches round in total 35 = 11 + 13 + 11 for 80 stitches
